member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsCredentialProvider
member.summary: Contains methods to get credentials for NuGet operations.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsCredentialProvider.GetCredentialsAsync(System.Uri,System.Net.IWebProxy,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get credentials for the supplied package source Uri.
member.param: The NuGet package source Uri for which credentials are being requested. Implementors are expected to first determine if this is a package source for which they can supply credentials. If not, then Null should be returned.
Web proxy to use when comunicating on the network. Null if there is no proxy authentication configured.
True if if this request is to get proxy authentication credentials. If the implementation is not valid for acquiring proxy credentials, then null should be returned.
True if credentials were previously acquired for this uri, but the supplied credentials did not allow authorized access.
If true, then interactive prompts must not be allowed.
This cancellation token should be checked to determine if the operation requesting credentials has been cancelled.
member.returns: Credentials acquired by this provider for the given package source uri. If the provider does not handle requests for the input parameter set, then null should be returned. If the provider does handle the request, but cannot supply credentials, an exception should be thrown.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkCompatibility
member.summary: Contains methods to discover frameworks and compatibility between frameworks.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkCompatibility.GetNetStandardFrameworks
member.summary: Gets all .NETStandard frameworks currently supported, in ascending order by version.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkCompatibility.GetFrameworksSupportingNetStandard(System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName)
member.summary: Gets frameworks that support packages of the provided .NETStandard version.
member.remarks: The result list is not exhaustive as it is meant to human-readable. For example, equivalent frameworks are not returned. Additionally, a framework name with version X in the result implies that framework names with versions greater than or equal to X but having the same are also supported.
member.param: The .NETStandard version to get supporting frameworks for.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkCompatibility.GetNearest(System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName})
member.summary: Selects the framework from that is nearest to the , according to NuGet's framework compatibility rules. null is returned of none of the frameworks are compatible.
member.param: The target framework.
The list of frameworks to choose from.
member.exception: If any of the arguments are null.
member.returns: The nearest framework.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkCompatibility2
member.summary: Contains methods to discover frameworks and compatibility between frameworks.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkCompatibility2.GetNearest(System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName})
member.summary: Selects the framework from that is nearest to the , according to NuGet's framework compatibility rules. null is returned of none of the frameworks are compatible.
member.param: The target framework.
Target frameworks to use if the provided is not compatible. These fallback frameworks are attempted in sequence after .
The list of frameworks to choose from.
member.exception: If any of the arguments are null.
member.returns: The nearest framework.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkParser
member.summary: An interface for dealing with the conversion between strings and instances.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkParser.ParseFrameworkName(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a short framework name (e.g. "net45") or a full framework name (e.g. ".NETFramework,Version=v4.5") into a instance.
member.param: The framework string.
member.exception: If the provided string is null.
If the provided string cannot be parsed.
member.returns: The parsed framework.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsFrameworkParser.GetShortFrameworkName(System.Runtime.Versioning.FrameworkName)
member.summary: Gets the shortened version of the framework name from a instance.
member.remarks: For example, ".NETFramework,Version=v4.5" is converted to "net45". This is the value used inside of .nupkg folder structures as well as in project.json files.
member.param: The framework name.
member.exception: If the provided framework name cannot be converted to a short name.
member.returns: The short framework name.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsGlobalPackagesInitScriptExecutor
member.summary: Execute powershell scripts from package(s) in a solution

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsGlobalPackagesInitScriptExecutor.ExecuteInitScriptAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the init script of the given package if available. 1) If the init.ps1 script has already been executed by the powershell host, it will not be executed again. True is returned. 2) If the package is found in the global packages folder it will be used. If not, it will return false and do nothing. 3) Also, note if other scripts are executing while this call was made, it will wait for them to complete.
member.param: Id of the package whose init.ps1 will be executed.
Version of the package whose init.ps1 will be executed.
member.returns: Returns true if the script was executed or has been executed already.
member.remarks: This method throws if the init.ps1 being executed throws.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller
member.summary: Contains methods to install packages into a project within the current solution.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackage(System.String,EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.Version,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Installs a single package from the specified package source.
member.param: The package source to install the package from. This value can be null to indicate that the user's configured sources should be used. Otherwise, this should be the source path as a string. If the user has credentials configured for a source, this value must exactly match the configured source value.
The target project for package installation.
The package ID of the package to install.
The version of the package to install. null can be provided to install the latest version of the package.
A boolean indicating whether or not to ignore the package's dependencies during installation.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackage(System.String,EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Installs a single package from the specified package source.
member.param: The package source to install the package from. This value can be null to indicate that the user's configured sources should be used. Otherwise, this should be the source path as a string. If the user has credentials configured for a source, this value must exactly match the configured source value.
The target project for package installation.
The package ID of the package to install.
The version of the package to install. null can be provided to install the latest version of the package.
A boolean indicating whether or not to ignore the package's dependencies during installation.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackage(NuGet.IPackageRepository,EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Installs a single package from the specified package source.
member.param: The package repository to install the package from.
The target project for package installation.
The package id of the package to install.
The version of the package to install. null can be provided to install the latest version of the package.
A boolean indicating whether or not to ignore the package's dependencies during installation.
A boolean indicating if assembly references from the package should be skipped.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackagesFromRegistryRepository(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,EnvDTE.Project,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Installs one or more packages that exist on disk in a folder defined in the registry.
member.param: The registry key name (under NuGet's repository key) that defines the folder on disk containing the packages.
A boolean indicating whether the folder contains packages that are pre-unzipped.
A boolean indicating whether the assembly references from the packages should be skipped.
The target project for package installation.
A dictionary of packages/versions to install where the key is the package id and the value is the version.
member.remarks:
If any version of the package is already installed, no action will be taken.
Dependencies are always ignored.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackagesFromRegistryRepository(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,EnvDTE.Project,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Installs one or more packages that exist on disk in a folder defined in the registry.
member.param: The registry key name (under NuGet's repository key) that defines the folder on disk containing the packages.
A boolean indicating whether the folder contains packages that are pre-unzipped.
A boolean indicating whether the assembly references from the packages should be skipped.
A boolean indicating whether the package's dependencies should be ignored
The target project for package installation.
A dictionary of packages/versions to install where the key is the package id and the value is the version.
member.remarks: If any version of the package is already installed, no action will be taken.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackagesFromVSExtensionRepository(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,EnvDTE.Project,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Installs one or more packages that are embedded in a Visual Studio Extension Package.
member.param: The Id of the Visual Studio Extension Package.
A boolean indicating whether the folder contains packages that are pre-unzipped.
A boolean indicating whether the assembly references from the packages should be skipped.
The target project for package installation
A dictionary of packages/versions to install where the key is the package id and the value is the version.
member.remarks:
If any version of the package is already installed, no action will be taken.
Dependencies are always ignored.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackagesFromVSExtensionRepository(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,EnvDTE.Project,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Installs one or more packages that are embedded in a Visual Studio Extension Package.
member.param: The Id of the Visual Studio Extension Package.
A boolean indicating whether the folder contains packages that are pre-unzipped.
A boolean indicating whether the assembly references from the packages should be skipped.
A boolean indicating whether the package's dependencies should be ignored
The target project for package installation
A dictionary of packages/versions to install where the key is the package id and the value is the version.
member.remarks: If any version of the package is already installed, no action will be taken.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller2
member.summary: Contains method to install latest version of a single package into a project within the current solution.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstaller2.InstallLatestPackage(System.String,EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Installs the latest version of a single package from the specified package source.
member.param: The package source to install the package from. This value can be null to indicate that the user's configured sources should be used. Otherwise, this should be the source path as a string. If the user has credentials configured for a source, this value must exactly match the configured source value.
The target project for package installation.
The package ID of the package to install.
Whether or not to consider prerelease versions when finding the latest version to install.
A boolean indicating whether or not to ignore the package's dependencies during installation.
member.exception: Thrown when is false and no stable version of the package exists.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents
member.summary: Contains events which are raised when packages are installed or uninstalled from projects and the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents.PackageInstalling
member.summary: Raised when a package is about to be installed into the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents.PackageInstalled
member.summary: Raised after a package has been installed into the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents.PackageUninstalling
member.summary: Raised when a package is about to be uninstalled from the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents.PackageUninstalled
member.summary: Raised after a package has been uninstalled from the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents.PackageReferenceAdded
member.summary: Raised after a package has been installed into a project within the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerEvents.PackageReferenceRemoved
member.summary: Raised after a package has been uninstalled from a project within the current solution.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerProjectEvents
member.summary: Contains batch events which are raised when packages are installed or uninstalled from projects with packages.config and the current solution.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerProjectEvents.BatchStart
member.summary: Raised before any IVsPackageInstallerEvents events are raised for a project.

member.name: E:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerProjectEvents.BatchEnd
member.summary: Raised after all IVsPackageInstallerEvents events are raised for a project.

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerServices
member.summary: Contains methods to query for installed packages within the current solution.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerServices.GetInstalledPackages
member.summary: Get the list of NuGet packages installed in the current solution.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerServices.IsPackageInstalled(EnvDTE.Project,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a NuGet package with the specified Id is installed in the specified project.
member.param: The project to check for NuGet package.
The id of the package to check.
member.returns: true if the package is install. false otherwise.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerServices.IsPackageInstalled(EnvDTE.Project,System.String,NuGet.SemanticVersion)
member.summary: Checks if a NuGet package with the specified Id and version is installed in the specified project.
member.param: The project to check for NuGet package.
The id of the package to check.
The version of the package to check.
member.returns: true if the package is install. false otherwise.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerServices.IsPackageInstalledEx(EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a NuGet package with the specified Id and version is installed in the specified project.
member.param: The project to check for NuGet package.
The id of the package to check.
The version of the package to check.
member.returns: true if the package is install. false otherwise.
member.remarks: The reason this method is named IsPackageInstalledEx, instead of IsPackageInstalled, is that when client project compiles against this assembly, the compiler would attempt to bind against the other overload which accepts SemanticVersion and would require client project to reference NuGet.Core.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageInstallerServices.GetInstalledPackages(EnvDTE.Project)
member.summary: Get the list of NuGet packages installed in the specified project.
member.param: The project to get NuGet packages from.

member.summary: Version of the package.

member.summary: Title of the package.

member.name: P:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageMetadata.Description

member.name: P:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageMetadata.Authors

member.name: P:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageMetadata.InstallPath
member.summary: The location where the package is installed on disk.

member.name: P:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageMetadata.VersionString
member.summary: The version of the package.
member.remarks: Use this property instead of the Version property becase with the type string, it doesn't require referencing NuGet.Core.dll assembly.

The package to be uninstalled

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContext
member.summary: NuGet path information specific to the current context (e.g. project context). Represents captured snapshot associated with current project/solution settings. Should be discarded immediately after all queries are done.

member.name: P:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContext.UserPackageFolder
member.summary: User package folder directory. The path returned is an absolute path.

member.name: P:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContext.FallbackPackageFolders
member.summary: Fallback package folder locations. The paths (if any) in the returned list are absolute paths. If no fallback package folders are configured, an empty list is returned. The item type of this sequence is .

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContext.TryResolvePackageAsset(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Fetch a package directory containing the provided asset path.
member.param: Absolute path to package asset file.
Full path to a package directory. null if returned falue is false.
member.returns: true when a package containing the given file was found, false - otherwise.
member.example:
Suppose the project is a packages.config project and the following asset paths are provided:
- C:\src\MyProject\packages\NuGet.Versioning.3.5.0-rc1-final\lib
et45\NuGet.Versioning.dll - C:\path	o
on\package\assembly\Newtonsoft.Json.dll - C:\src\MyOtherProject\packages\NuGet.Core.2.12.0\lib
et40\NuGet.Core.dll - C:\src\MyProject\packages\Autofac.3.5.2\lib
et40\Autofac.dll - C:\src\MyProject\packages\Autofac.3.5.2\lib
et40\Autofac.Fake.dll
The result will be:
- C:\src\MyProject\packages\NuGet.Versioning.3.5.0-rc1-final - null - null - C:\src\MyProject\packages\Autofac.3.5.2 - C:\src\MyProject\packages\Autofac.3.5.2

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContextProvider
member.summary: A factory to initialize instances.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContextProvider.TryCreateContext(System.String,NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPathContext@)
member.summary: Attempts to create an instance of .
member.param: Unique identificator of the project. Should be a full path to project file.
The path context associated with given project.
member.returns: True if operation has succeeded and context was created. False, otherwise, e.g. when provided project is not managed by NuGet.

member.summary: Contains methods to migrate a project.json based legacy project to PackageReference based project.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsProjectJsonToPackageReferenceMigrator.MigrateProjectJsonToPackageReferenceAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Migrates a legacy Project.json based project to Package Reference based project. The result should be casted to type The backup of the original project file and project.json file is created in the Backup folder in the root of the project directory.
member.param: The full path to the project that needs to be migrated

member.name: T:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsSemanticVersionComparer
member.summary: An interface for comparing two opaque version strings by treating them as NuGet semantic versions.

member.name: M:NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsSemanticVersionComparer.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two version strings as if they were NuGet semantic version strings. Returns a number less than zero if is less than . Returns zero if the two versions are equivalent. Returns a number greater than zero if is greater than .
member.param: The first version string.
The second version string.
member.exception: If either version string is null.
If either string cannot be parsed.
member.returns: A standard comparison integer based on the relationship between the two provided versions.

member.name: T:NuGet.SemanticVersion
member.summary: This is the legacy implementation of the semantic version class. NuGet 2.x implemented this under the NuGet namespace. In NuGet 3.x, we moved SemanticVersion to NuGet.Versioning.SemanticVersion. We exposed multiple public APIs that have the type NuGet.SemanticVersion. Therefore, we still need to have a semantic version class implemented at the old location.

member.name: P:NuGet.SemanticVersion.Version
member.summary: Gets the normalized version portion.

member.name: P:NuGet.SemanticVersion.SpecialVersion
member.summary: Gets the optional special version.

member.name: M:NuGet.SemanticVersion.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a version string using loose semantic versioning rules that allows 2-4 version components followed by an optional special version.

member.name: M:NuGet.SemanticVersion.TryParse(System.String,NuGet.SemanticVersion@)
member.summary: Parses a version string using loose semantic versioning rules that allows 2-4 version components followed by an optional special version.

member.name: M:NuGet.SemanticVersion.TryParseStrict(System.String,NuGet.SemanticVersion@)
member.summary: Parses a version string using strict semantic versioning rules that allows exactly 3 components and an optional special version.

member.name: M:NuGet.SemanticVersion.ParseOptionalVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to parse the version token as a SemanticVersion.
member.returns: An instance of SemanticVersion if it parses correctly, null otherwise.

member.name: M:NuGet.SemanticVersion.ToNormalizedString
member.summary: Returns the normalized string representation of this instance of . If the instance can be strictly parsed as a , the normalized version string if of the format {major}.{minor}.{build}[-{special-version}]. If the instance has a non-zero value for , the format is {major}.{minor}.{build}.{revision}[-{special-version}].
member.returns: The normalized string representation.

member.summary: Compares two enumberables for equality, ordered according to the specified key and optional comparer. Handles null values gracefully.
member.typeparam: The type of the sorting key
member.param: This list
The other list
The function to extract the key from each item in the list
An optional comparer for comparing keys
An optional comparer for sequences

member.summary: Compares two sequence for equality, allowing either sequence to be null. If one is null, both have to be null for equality.
